channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 情報筋フォックス・ニュースの重役ジェイ・ウォレスとスザンヌ・スコットが、トランプに8月23日の討論会に出席するよう働きかけた。
item.description:
New York Times:
Sources: Fox News execs Jay Wallace and Suzanne Scott lobbied Trump to appear at an August 23 debate, during a private dinner just after his third indictment  —  The Fox leaders appealed to the former president to participate in the first G.O.P. debate, which is being hosted by the network.

item.title: 15万人以上の購読者を持つ経済・政策ニュースについての偽名サブスタック出版物「ドゥームバーグ」が、サブスタックノート（ドゥームバーグ）に集中するためにツイッターを離れると発表。
item.description:
Doomberg:
Doomberg, a pseudonymous Substack publication about economic and policy news with 150K+ subscribers, announces it is leaving Twitter to focus on Substack Notes  —  The Work of My Life: July 2023 Report  —  “There is a time for departure even when there's no certain place to go.”  - Tennessee Williams

item.title: イーロン・マスクによると、Xはクリエイターへの支払い方針を修正し、支払いが10万ドルを超えるまではカットしないようにし、App Storeの手数料引き下げについてティム・クックと話し合う予定だという（Elon Musk/@elonmusk）
item.description:
Elon Musk / @elonmusk:
Elon Musk says X will amend its creator payouts policy to take no cut until a payout exceeds $100K, and plans to talk to Tim Cook about lower App Store fees  —  Super Important to Support Creators! If you can afford it, please subscribe to as many creators on this platform as you find interesting. People from every corner of the world post incredible content on 𝕏, but often live in tough circumstances, where even a few hundred...

item.title: アップルはiTunesでクラシック音楽を救えなかったが、Apple Music Classicalで再び失敗した。
item.description:
Alex Ross / New Yorker:
Apple failed to save classical music with iTunes and fails again with Apple Music Classical, an oddly clumsy point of entry that falls short of its competitors  —  As classical listeners shift to streaming, Apple's bespoke app falls short of its smaller-scale competitors.

item.title: ファイリングWWE会長ビンス・マクマホンは7月に捜索令状と召喚令状に直面し、現在は休養中。エンデバーのUFCとの合併は順調（Alex Weprin/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
Filing: WWE Executive Chairman Vince McMahon faced a search warrant and subpoena in July and is now on medical leave; the merger with Endeavor's UFC is on track  —  The WWE said in a footnote to a SEC filing that federal agents executed a search warrant and served a federal grand jury subpoena on McMahon July 17.

item.title: デジタルメディア企業Factzがセレブ芸能ニュースサイトHollywood Lifeを買収、創業者でEICのボニー・フラーは退社（Emily Longeretta/Variety）
item.description:
Emily Longeretta / Variety:
Digital media company Factz acquires celebrity entertainment news site Hollywood Life; founder and EIC Bonnie Fuller leaves the company  —  Factz, a digital media company, acquired the celebrity entertainment news site HollywoodLife.com on Tuesday.  Founder, president and editor-in-chief Bonnie Fuller is no longer part of the company.

item.title: PBSは、「ワシントン・ウィーク」を「ワシントン・ウィーク・ウィズ・ジ・アトランティック」と改称し、ジェフリー・ゴールドバーグEICが「ワシントン・ウィーク」の次期司会を務めると発表した（Benjamin Mullin/New York Times）。
item.description:
Benjamin Mullin / New York Times:
PBS announces that The Atlantic EIC Jeffrey Goldberg will be the next moderator of Washington Week, which will be renamed Washington Week With The Atlantic  —  The Atlantic will co-produce the show, which will be renamed “Washington Week With The Atlantic.”  The publication will cover some of the costs and help sell sponsorships.

item.title: トムソン・ロイター、第2四半期の営業利益は前年同期比111％増の8億2500万ドル、売上高は同2％増の16億ドル、ニュース収入は1％増の1億9400万ドル（Helen Coster/Reuters）
item.description:
Helen Coster / Reuters:
Thomson Reuters reports Q2 operating profit up 111% YoY to $825M and revenue up 2% YoY to $1.6B; News revenue grew 1% to $194M  —  Thomson Reuters Corp (TRI.TO), on Wednesday reported higher sales and operating profit in the second quarter, helped by strong performance at its “Big 3” segments …

item.title: Meta、MusicGen、AudioGen、EnCodecモデルからなる、テキストプロンプトで音楽やサウンドを作成できるオープンソースAIツール「AudioCraft」をリリース（Emilia David/The Verge）
item.description:
Emilia David / The Verge:
Meta releases AudioCraft, an open-source AI tool that lets users create music and sounds via text prompts, consisting of MusicGen, AudioGen, and EnCodec models  —  It consists of three AI models, all tackling different areas of sound generation.  MusicGen takes text inputs to generate music.

item.title: 2000万ドルを調達したフィクション専門のポッドキャスト会社レルムが、キッズコンテンツ会社ピンナと台本なしの番組に特化したリップスティック＆ビニールを買収（Ashley Carman/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Ashley Carman / Bloomberg:
Fiction-focused podcast company Realm, which has raised $20M, acquires kids content company Pinna and Lipstick & Vinyl, which focuses on unscripted shows  —  The fiction-focused business is also acquiring Lipstick & Vinyl and partnering with family programmers on ads

item.title: ソロモン・スター紙をはじめとするソロモン諸島の新聞が、中国からの資金提供を受けて批判にさらされる（Charley Piringi/The Guardian）
item.description:
Charley Piringi / The Guardian:
The Solomon Star and other newspapers in the Solomon Islands face criticism after accepting funding from China in exchange for positive coverage  —  The Solomon Star denies accusations of ‘giving away’ its independence by accepting thousands of dollars' worth of equipment

item.title: MPA：東南アジアの2023年上半期の新規ストリーミング加入者純増数はわずか7K、2022年下半期の700万から減少、総加入者数は4,760万、動画ストリーミング分数の42％はTikTokが占める（Liz Shackleton/Deadline）
item.description:
Liz Shackleton / Deadline:
MPA: Southeast Asia added only 7K net new streaming subscribers in H1 2023, down from 7M in H2 2022, for 47.6M total; TikTok had 42% of video streaming minutes  —  Southeast Asia only added 7,000 net new SVOD subscriptions in the first half of 2023, a big slowdown from 7 million new subscribers …

item.title: People、The Washington Times、MarketWatchなどが、バービー人形が2030年までにプラスチックフリーになるという手の込んだデマに引っかかった。
item.description:
New York Times:
People, The Washington Times, MarketWatch, and others fell for an elaborate hoax that claimed Barbie dolls would be plastic free by 2030; most removed the posts  —  The false campaign by environmental activists claimed that the toy giant was launching a new line of decomposable Barbies and would stop using plastic by 2030.

item.title: 元ワシントン・ポスト紙編集長マーティ・バロン氏とのQ&A：商業的に成功するモデルを自分たちで見つける必要性、オーナーの役割などについて（Mark Caro/Local News Initiative）
item.description:
Mark Caro / Local News Initiative:
Q&A with ex-Washington Post chief Marty Baron on the need for outlets to figure out a commercially successful model by themselves, the role of owners, and more  —  In Pt. 1 of interview, Marty Baron calls on journalists to stop the nostalgia and doom-and-gloom and to focus on solving problems and making tough choices

item.title: AIがどのようにニュースを変えるかについての3つの説：一部の報道機関に完全に取って代わるか、役に立つツールになるか、報道機関をワイヤーサービスに変えるか（John Herrman/New York Magazine）
item.description:
John Herrman / New York Magazine:
Three theories about how AI will change the news: replace some outlets entirely, be a helpful tool, or turn news organizations into wire services  —  Here are three theories of the case.  —  In early July, the Associated Press made a deal with OpenAI, maker of ChatGPT, to license …
